title: The Brothers York by Thomas Penn, review: the bad boys of the medieval English throne
text:
Thomas Penn subtitles The Brothers York, an exceptionally detailed and absorbing narrative history of the three sons of Richard, Duke of York, who together fought, won and lost the Wars of the Roses, “an English tragedy”. He thus quietly acknowledges that many of his readers will be aware of Edward IV, George, Duke of Clarence and Richard III primarily as Shakespearean characters.

Penn puts Shakespeare firmly in his place by the elegant strategy of almost total omission; he can hardly be accused, however, of leaving out anyone else. So vast is the canvas, so lovingly frenetic the incident, that The Brothers York certainly comes down, as is in the circumstances suitable, on the side of history...
